name: Mobile App Launch Timing
description: Decision to launch mobile app on Feb 1st vs delay to March 1st

courtroom.question: Should we launch the mobile app on February 1st, 2026?
context: App is currently in beta with 500 users. Beta users report occasional slowness during peak times.
Marketing campaign is already scheduled for Feb 1st launch. Ads are purchased and press releases drafted.
Engineering team is 4 developers with no dedicated DevOps/SRE. No on-call rotation established yet.
Infrastructure: Single Heroku dyno, Postgres database, Redis cache. Current scale is 500 users.
Projected launch day traffic: 10,000 users (20x current beta size).
Alternative: Delay to March 1st to implement auto-scaling, monitoring, and on-call rotation.
Delaying costs: $50k in marketing spend already committed, loss of seasonal timing advantage.
Support team is 2 people who also handle other products.

redBlueTeam.system: Mobile app backend running on single Heroku dyno with Postgres database and Redis cache. REST API built with Node.js/Express. JWT authentication. Rate limiting at 100 req/min per IP. No auto-scaling configured. No monitoring beyond Heroku metrics. No on-call rotation.
context: Currently handles 500 beta users without issues
Expected launch day traffic: 10,000 users (20x increase)
Single database with no read replicas
No load testing beyond 500 concurrent users

preMortem.proposal: Launch mobile app to production on February 1st, 2026
context: App is in beta with 500 active users
Marketing campaign already scheduled and ads purchased
Engineering team: 4 developers, no DevOps/SRE
No formal on-call rotation established
Infrastructure: Single Heroku dyno, Postgres, Redis
Beta users report occasional slowness during peak times
Support team: 2 people who also handle other products
Expected launch day traffic: ~10,000 users (20x current)
